title: Design theory book...
content:
Hi,

Ive been searching for a good intro book to design theory and design movements. Im not looking for thought relating to graphic design in particular but design theory and though that relates to all forms of design. I dont know if this kind of book even exists out there but Im hoping it does.

I have a pretty basic understanding of design movements like modernism and functionalism for instance but I want to learn how these ways of thinking and designing are related and how they have evolved and what designers were associated. A book with images that show examples would be a bonus also. Some critical essays and good all around coverage of the timeline would be nice also.

So does anyone know of such a book.... ?
author: outerone

comments.content: No about -isms but about the practice of being a designer, Norman Potter's 'What is a designer: Things, places, messages' might be interesting.

Hey Santa... !

^ Thanks for those links, those books seem very informative and I might just have to write Santa a letter.

What about books with good critical essays written by both the American and European graphic designers....

In response to your original query, [_The Bauhaus Ideal: Then and Now_](http://web.archive.org/web/20110102160447/http:/www.amazon.com/Bauhaus-Ideal-Illustrated-Modernist-Design/dp/0897335228/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1196982128&sr=1-1) is a good introduction to the differences between Modernism and Postmodernism in design.
